result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Carl Raunio

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Carl Raunio in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for John Carl Raunio.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant John Carl Raunio in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Matthew Plummer, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John Carl Raunio in court.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey, as a friend of the court, in court for John Carl Raunio.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Discussion regarding status of counsel placed on the record. As of today's defendant, defendant is NOT eligible for public defender representation. Defendant to provide paperwork to the Public Defender's Office to possibly change his eligibility for representation. For reasons stated on the record, Court adjourns the matter for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John Carl Raunio in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer, as a friend to the court.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant informs the court that he would prefer to appear pro-se. Court adjourns matter for a Status Conference date to Br 29.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with L.E.H.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John Carl Raunio in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/11/22 @ 2p
